description: Borrowed from Persian زکات‎ (zakât), from Arabic زَكَاة‎ (zakāh), from earlier Arabic زَكَوٰة‎ (zakāh).

entries.meaning: (Islam) Almsgiving, one of the five pillars of Islam.
examples: Amongst these stations is the well-known place called Qatya, where zakat is collected from the merchants, their goods are examined and their baggage most rigorously searched.
